Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 13, mean = 59, sd = 8.31. Sample 2: n = 11, mean = 41, sd = 6.72. The pooled variance estimator has the value 58.19. It is tested whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 12 and 10 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 13 and 11 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 24 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 22 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 12 and 10 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 13 and 11 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 24 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 22 degrees of freedom: Correct
